intro: Comolia villosa, commonly known as the hairy comolia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Comolia villosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
